Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse and reflect on the influence of values and beliefs on the development of identities
Elaboration: Examining how their values and beliefs, as well as those of family and friends, influence the development of identities

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse and reflect on the influence of values and beliefs on the development of identities
Elaboration: Analysing how naming of deceased protocols, such as kumanjayi, can impact the identities of other members within First Nations Australian communities

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse and reflect on the influence of values and beliefs on the development of identities
Elaboration: Examining how cultural values and beliefs influence the way young people view themselves, including young Australians of Asian heritage

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse and reflect on the influence of values and beliefs on the development of identities
Elaboration: Examining how cultural beliefs about the physical changes experienced during puberty can influence gender, cultural and sexual identities

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse the impact of changes and transitions, and devise strategies to support themselves and others through these changes
Elaboration: Investigating the changing nature of peer and family relationships and proposing strategies to manage these changes

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse the impact of changes and transitions, and devise strategies to support themselves and others through these changes
Elaboration: Accessing and assessing health information and services that support young people to effectively manage changes and transitions as they grow older, including sexual health information about sexually transmitted infections, contraception and safe sexual practices

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse the impact of changes and transitions, and devise strategies to support themselves and others through these changes
Elaboration: Examining how ceremonies of First Nations Australians involve sharing of cultural knowledge leading to changes in social standing and responsibilities in communities

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse the impact of changes and transitions, and devise strategies to support themselves and others through these changes
Elaboration: Examining the notion of “border crossing”; that is, how First Nations Australians live across multiple cultures, and how these transitions can impact on a sense of belonging to culture, family and peer groups

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse the impact of changes and transitions, and devise strategies to support themselves and others through these changes
Elaboration: Evaluating and practising coping, communication and problem-solving skills to manage changes and emotions associated with puberty and getting older

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Examine how roles, decision-making, and levels of power, coercion and control within relationships can be influenced by gender stereotypes
Elaboration: Exploring scenarios in texts that demonstrate how gender inequality can arise from intergenerational patterns of inequity and unequal power in relationships

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Examine how roles, decision-making, and levels of power, coercion and control within relationships can be influenced by gender stereotypes
Elaboration: Examining how gender roles and stereotypes can influence beliefs and decisions about self, friendships, sexual relationships, sexual behaviour, contraceptive use, substance use and future life plans

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Examine how roles, decision-making, and levels of power, coercion and control within relationships can be influenced by gender stereotypes
Elaboration: Identifying those positive character attributes and strengths that are valued regardless of gender

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Examine how roles, decision-making, and levels of power, coercion and control within relationships can be influenced by gender stereotypes
Elaboration: Investigating strategies that have been successful in challenging harmful or limiting stereotypes, attitudes or practices

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Examine the roles of respect, empathy, power and coercion in developing respectful relationships
Elaboration: Analysing how behaviours, actions and responses to situations can change depending on whether they are by themselves, with friends or with family

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Examine the roles of respect, empathy, power and coercion in developing respectful relationships
Elaboration: Recognising the impact bullying and harassment can have on relationships, including online relationships

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Examine the roles of respect, empathy, power and coercion in developing respectful relationships
Elaboration: Showing respect for cultural norms and sensitivities when building relationships with people from different cultural backgrounds

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Examine the roles of respect, empathy, power and coercion in developing respectful relationships
Elaboration: Proposing strategies for addressing racism towards First Nations Australians, including the role of bystanders in promoting respectful interactions and challenging disrespect and discrimination

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Examine the roles of respect, empathy, power and coercion in developing respectful relationships
Elaboration: Examining what constitutes disrespectful, harmful or violent behaviour within peer, family and intimate relationships

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate strategies that influence how communities value diversity and propose actions they can take to promote inclusion in their communities
Elaboration: Investigating how respecting diversity and challenging racism, sexism, ableism (disability discrimination) and homophobia influence individual and community health and wellbeing

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate strategies that influence how communities value diversity and propose actions they can take to promote inclusion in their communities
Elaboration: Examining values and beliefs about cultural and social issues such as gender, race, violence, sexuality and ability, and how resisting stereotypes can help students be themselves

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate strategies that influence how communities value diversity and propose actions they can take to promote inclusion in their communities
Elaboration: Developing strategies to challenge narrow views of gender, race, violence, sexuality, gender diversity and ability to contribute to inclusive communities

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate strategies that influence how communities value diversity and propose actions they can take to promote inclusion in their communities
Elaboration: Researching how norms, stereotypes and prejudice are challenged in local, national and global contexts

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate strategies that influence how communities value diversity and propose actions they can take to promote inclusion in their communities
Elaboration: Investigating events and strategies that value the contributions of First Nations Australians and strengthen relationships, such as Indigenous rounds in sporting codes and NAIDOC Week

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate strategies that influence how communities value diversity and propose actions they can take to promote inclusion in their communities
Elaboration: Identifying examples of beliefs and cultural practices within, between and across cultural groups, including cultural groups from the Asian region, and describing how they have changed or remained the same over time

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse factors that influence emotional responses and devise strategies to self-manage emotions
Elaboration: Investigating personal, social and cultural factors that influence the way individuals respond emotionally to different situations and determining the impact these responses could have on others

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse factors that influence emotional responses and devise strategies to self-manage emotions
Elaboration: Exploring different viewpoints, practising being empathetic and considering alternative ways to respond in a variety of situations, which take into account how they may affect others

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse factors that influence emotional responses and devise strategies to self-manage emotions
Elaboration: Recognising and interpreting emotional responses to stressful situations and proposing strategies for ensuring those responses don’t have a negative impact on others

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Explain and apply skills and strategies to communicate assertively and respectfully when seeking, giving or denying consent
Elaboration: Exploring and refining skills and strategies needed to communicate assertively and respectfully in relationships.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Explain and apply skills and strategies to communicate assertively and respectfully when seeking, giving or denying consent
Elaboration: Understanding and applying online and social protocols to enhance relationships with others and protect their own wellbeing, including recognising and responding to online content that may be harmful for themselves or others (such as grooming or image-based abuse), respectfully communicating needs or concerns to others

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Explain and apply skills and strategies to communicate assertively and respectfully when seeking, giving or denying consent
Elaboration: Examining the nature of consent in different types of relationships, and proposing and practising strategies for seeking, giving and denying consent respectfully

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Refine protective behaviours and evaluate community resources to seek help for themselves and others
Elaboration: Exploring different strategies they can use, and resources or help sites they can access or refer others to, if they are experiencing symptoms of anxiety or depression

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Refine protective behaviours and evaluate community resources to seek help for themselves and others
Elaboration: Examining scenarios to highlight how emotions, dispositions, social supports, and gender and cultural norms can affect a person’s willingness to seek help

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Refine protective behaviours and evaluate community resources to seek help for themselves and others
Elaboration: Exploring strategies for dealing with online abuse and bullying when there is an imbalance of power, such as grooming, image-based abuse or negative social interactions, and reporting the situation to appropriate authorities, trusted adults and through online tools

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Refine protective behaviours and evaluate community resources to seek help for themselves and others
Elaboration: Collaborating with peers to suggest strategies they could use if they are being encouraged to use a substance such as alcohol, e-cigarettes, cannabis or inhalants

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Refine protective behaviours and evaluate community resources to seek help for themselves and others
Elaboration: Analysing how bystanders play a role in ensuring online spaces are positive and safe, and examining how support services such as kidshelpline and the eSafety Commissioner can provide support for young people who feel unsafe, bullied or abused online

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Refine protective behaviours and evaluate community resources to seek help for themselves and others
Elaboration: Exploring help-seeking scenarios young people may encounter and sharing strategies for dealing with each situation, including situations linked to substance use, mental health issues, safety and risk-taking, and sexual health

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate how media and influential people impact attitudes, beliefs, decisions and behaviours in relation to health, safety, relationships and wellbeing
Elaboration: Analysing the credibility, validity and relevance of health messages conveyed by different sources (including news sites, bloggers, influencers and social media advertising) and applying credible information to health-related decisions

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate how media and influential people impact attitudes, beliefs, decisions and behaviours in relation to health, safety, relationships and wellbeing
Elaboration: Investigating how messages related to food are portrayed in the media and how this may impact decision-making in relation to health and wellbeing

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate how media and influential people impact attitudes, beliefs, decisions and behaviours in relation to health, safety, relationships and wellbeing
Elaboration: Exploring and evaluating the accessibility and reliability of health information sources from the media that target young people in relation to their health, wellbeing, body, sexuality, relationships and other health issues

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate how media and influential people impact attitudes, beliefs, decisions and behaviours in relation to health, safety, relationships and wellbeing
Elaboration: Exploring health campaigns targeting First Nations Australian young people and discussing the messages and strategies used to promote and enhance their health; for example, Deadly Choices, Don’t Make Smokes Your Story and Yarn Safe

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate how media and influential people impact attitudes, beliefs, decisions and behaviours in relation to health, safety, relationships and wellbeing
Elaboration: Analysing how messages related to sexual relationships are portrayed in different forms of media and how they may influence the way people act within relationships

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Plan and implement strategies, using health resources, to enhance their own and others’ health, safety, relationships and wellbeing
Elaboration: Proposing and implementing actions and behaviours that promote safe participation in physical activities, and evaluating the impact participation can have on their own and others’ mood and mental wellbeing

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Plan and implement strategies, using health resources, to enhance their own and others’ health, safety, relationships and wellbeing
Elaboration: Investigating food-serving recommendations from The Australian Guide to Healthy Eating and producing a guide to help students make healthy choices when buying food from the school canteen

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Plan and implement strategies, using health resources, to enhance their own and others’ health, safety, relationships and wellbeing
Elaboration: Researching a variety of snack and lunch options, and evaluating nutritional value, value for money and sustainability to create a weekly menu plan; considering the benefits of eating locally grown, chemical-free produce to support personal health benefits, reduce food miles and support local producers

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Plan and implement strategies, using health resources, to enhance their own and others’ health, safety, relationships and wellbeing
Elaboration: Investigating how First Nations Australians have developed complete diets that meet nutritional requirements, and used and continue to use food for medicinal purposes

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Plan and implement strategies, using health resources, to enhance their own and others’ health, safety, relationships and wellbeing
Elaboration: Examining how different cultures value the contribution of the mind–body–spirit connection to health and wellbeing; for example, Dadirri – the Aboriginal meditative practice of deep listening developed and shared by First Nations Australians of the Daly River region, and yoga and meditation practices from the Asia region

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Plan and implement strategies, using health resources, to enhance their own and others’ health, safety, relationships and wellbeing
Elaboration: Investigating preventive health practices relevant to young people, and designing and implementing health promotion activities targeting these practices

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Plan and implement strategies, using health resources, to enhance their own and others’ health, safety, relationships and wellbeing
Elaboration: Investigating tools and designing routines that help to regulate the use of digital environments and tools and ensure a healthy pattern of use, such as using “do not disturb” mode or turning off notifications

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Plan and implement strategies, using health resources, to enhance their own and others’ health, safety, relationships and wellbeing
Elaboration: Investigating different approaches and developing personal plans for promoting their own positive mental health and wellbeing, such as mindfulness, relaxation techniques and healthy eating

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse, refine and transfer movement skills in a variety of movement situations
Elaboration: Implementing feedback from a teacher to refine how they move within the playing or performance space

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse, refine and transfer movement skills in a variety of movement situations
Elaboration: Using feedback from teammates in a game to know when to travel, mark or intercept to achieve and retain possession

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse, refine and transfer movement skills in a variety of movement situations
Elaboration: Using feedback from a peer coach to adapt movement sequences to create, use and defend space in invasion, net/court, striking and fielding, and target games

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse, refine and transfer movement skills in a variety of movement situations
Elaboration: Refining a range of swimming strokes using feedback from a teacher, peers or video resources

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse, refine and transfer movement skills in a variety of movement situations
Elaboration: Using feedback from others to refine the composition of a group dance sequence

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse, refine and transfer movement skills in a variety of movement situations
Elaboration: Using feedback from others to safely and efficiently travel around, over, up, under and through natural or built obstacles

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Design and demonstrate how movement strategies can be manipulated to improve movement outcomes
Elaboration: Developing and implementing appropriate strategies for selected movement scenarios

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Design and demonstrate how movement strategies can be manipulated to improve movement outcomes
Elaboration: Selecting strategies that have been successful previously and applying the most appropriate ones when solving new movement challenges

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Design and demonstrate how movement strategies can be manipulated to improve movement outcomes
Elaboration: Exploring similarities between the bases of support and flow of movements when performing different movement sequences that require static and dynamic balance

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Design and demonstrate how movement strategies can be manipulated to improve movement outcomes
Elaboration: Predicting the effectiveness of changes in tactics or strategies on scoring opportunities and suggesting reasons for any unexpected results

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Demonstrate and explain how movement concepts related to effort, space, time, objects and people can be manipulated to improve movement outcomes
Elaboration: Performing a range of movements and analysing technique based on understanding of effort in relation to take-off, body position and landing

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Demonstrate and explain how movement concepts related to effort, space, time, objects and people can be manipulated to improve movement outcomes
Elaboration: Demonstrating an understanding of how to adjust the angle of release of an object and how this will affect the height and distance of flight

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Demonstrate and explain how movement concepts related to effort, space, time, objects and people can be manipulated to improve movement outcomes
Elaboration: Creating, performing and appraising rhythmic movement sequences that demonstrate variations in flow of movements, use of space and relationships to other performers

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Demonstrate and explain how movement concepts related to effort, space, time, objects and people can be manipulated to improve movement outcomes
Elaboration: Designing and refining performances to demonstrate how to manipulate space and relationships between players in the space to achieve successful movement outcomes

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in physical activities designed to improve fitness and wellbeing to investigate the impact of regular participation on health, fitness and wellbeing
Elaboration: Using digital tools to design personal physical activity programs that support regular participation and meet their individual health, wellbeing and fitness goals

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in physical activities designed to improve fitness and wellbeing to investigate the impact of regular participation on health, fitness and wellbeing
Elaboration: Designing and performing a fitness circuit they could implement at home (with minimal equipment) that improves one or more fitness components

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in physical activities designed to improve fitness and wellbeing to investigate the impact of regular participation on health, fitness and wellbeing
Elaboration: Researching and participating in new activities to explore how they can enhance health, fitness and wellbeing, such as yoga, mindfulness meditation, gym classes, HIIT sessions

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in physical activities that utilise community spaces and outdoor settings, and evaluate strategies to support increased use of these spaces
Elaboration: Evaluating different strategies used to manage and protect environments where physical activities take place, such as bushwalking trails, surf beaches, skate parks and sporting fields

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in physical activities that utilise community spaces and outdoor settings, and evaluate strategies to support increased use of these spaces
Elaboration: Investigating different approaches to custodial responsibility for Country/Place used by First Nations Australian communities to support the use of local settings and spaces for physical activity while protecting the environment

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in physical activities that utilise community spaces and outdoor settings, and evaluate strategies to support increased use of these spaces
Elaboration: Designing and evaluating physical activity options that reimagine the use of community spaces to encourage more active lifestyles among their peer group

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in physical activities that utilise community spaces and outdoor settings, and evaluate strategies to support increased use of these spaces
Elaboration: Promoting an understanding of minimal-impact outdoor recreation in the local area

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Design and justify strategies to increase physical activity levels to achieve health and wellbeing outcomes
Elaboration: Designing and monitoring a personal physical activity plan that proposes realistic strategies for increasing physical activity levels and reducing sedentary behaviours

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Design and justify strategies to increase physical activity levels to achieve health and wellbeing outcomes
Elaboration: Investigating which physical activities people engage in to maintain emotional and social wellbeing, and designing a program of activities aimed at increasing social connection and wellbeing

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Design and justify strategies to increase physical activity levels to achieve health and wellbeing outcomes
Elaboration: Comparing their current physical activity levels, amount of sleep and sedentary activity time with Australia’s 24-Hour Movement Guidelines for Children and Young People and suggesting strategies for themselves and others to meet these recommendations

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Propose and evaluate movement strategies and skills that would be most effective in different movement situations
Elaboration: Evaluating factors that enabled them to achieve success in movement activities and justifying how these factors can be transferred to other learning contexts

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Propose and evaluate movement strategies and skills that would be most effective in different movement situations
Elaboration: Explaining and justifying the movement strategies selected in response to movement challenges when participating in outdoor or nature-based activities such as rope courses, bushwalking, orienteering or canoeing

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Propose and evaluate movement strategies and skills that would be most effective in different movement situations
Elaboration: Putting their movement solutions into action by predicting outcomes and testing the approach proposed to achieve successful movement outcomes

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate modifications to equipment, rules and scoring systems that support fair play and inclusive participation
Elaboration: Modifying rules, equipment or scoring systems to allow all participants to enjoy success in physical activities

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate modifications to equipment, rules and scoring systems that support fair play and inclusive participation
Elaboration: Applying and adapting scoring systems in activities to assess movement performances consistently and fairly

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate modifications to equipment, rules and scoring systems that support fair play and inclusive participation
Elaboration: Analysing the benefits and potential drawbacks of activities where players, rather than an independent official, are responsible for officiating the game

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate modifications to equipment, rules and scoring systems that support fair play and inclusive participation
Elaboration: Exploring rules, equipment and scoring systems of traditional games of First Nations Australians and investigating how they support skill development and fair and inclusive play

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Practise and apply leadership, collaboration and group decision-making processes when participating in a range of physical activities
Elaboration: Adopting roles and responsibilities that support and enhance team cohesion and lead to successful movement outcomes

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Practise and apply leadership, collaboration and group decision-making processes when participating in a range of physical activities
Elaboration: Applying an understanding of verbal, physical and situational cues to identify and appropriately respond to the feelings and motives of others when working in a team or group

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Practise and apply leadership, collaboration and group decision-making processes when participating in a range of physical activities
Elaboration: Reflecting on their role and articulating how the actions they initiated in that role led to the achievement of successful outcomes

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Practise and apply leadership, collaboration and group decision-making processes when participating in a range of physical activities
Elaboration: Undertaking various roles as a leader or collaborator to support the planning of physical activities for their team or peer group
